item.title: All the adults colouring is leading to huge sales for pencil companies
item.description:
All the adults colouring is leading to huge sales for pencil companies

SYDNEY, Australia - So many adults are spending their days colouring in the lines, pencil companies are struggling to cope with the demand for coloured pencils and felt tip pens. Staedtler , the German company which produces felt tip pens and coloured pencils, has seen significant growth in Australia as adults get obsessed with the mindful trend.

item.title: Best of CH 2015: Instagram
item.description:
Best of CH 2015: Instagram

Four and a half years ago we joined Instagram and have posted over 2,500 images since. More than 99% of the photographs we share, we ourselves have taken, and that's something we're quite proud of.

item.title: Twin peaks: Vollebak's high-tech sportswear aids recovery.
item.description:
Twin peaks: Vollebak's high-tech sportswear aids recovery.

Hi-tech sportswear generally makes a number of simple promises, usually concentrating on the during of what you do rather than the before or after. New London-based adventure clothing brand Vollebak takes a more experimental, tangential approach to performance enhancement.

item.title: Underwater Dogs: photographs of dogs underwater by Seth Casteel
item.description:
Underwater Dogs: photographs of dogs underwater by Seth Casteel

Underwater Dogs - a book containing over 80 unique photographs of dogs underwater snapped by animal photographer Seth Casteel is published on 25th October 2012 by Headline Books, priced £14.99.

item.title: Illustration
item.description:
Illustration

As part of his Celestial Series, Chicago-based digital artist David Brodeur rendered an alien world filled with berry-like plants, glowing crystals, and candy shaped orbs that sprout from the ground. Despite their exotic designs, Brodeur relies on common colors of familiar fruits to create this Willy Wonka-esque habitat where you can't help but want to reach out and gobble everything up.

item.title: There's brew love in a new lager saga: Daniel Noah Sheikh reinvents beer.
item.description:
There's brew love in a new lager saga: Daniel Noah Sheikh reinvents beer.

The crafting and consumption of artisanal ale has come to define hipsterdom as surely as unchecked facial hair and tattoos. Lager, once the fashionable brew, has been largely left out in the cold. One young MÃ¼nchner, though, is determined on rebuilding buzz around bold but bubbly Bavarian beer.
